result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Charles G Kreckel was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
The Conditions for Extended Supervision are the same as the Conditions for Probation.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes:
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs ($35) to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of New Berlin Police Department.  Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.  
DNA surcharge ($250) - cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel during the period of probation.

Cash bail applied to fine.  Balance of fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours with Standard Release Conditions.
To commence forthwith.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Charles G Kreckel in court with attorney Ronald J. Sonderhouse.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern supervised by ADA Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.
Count 2 is dismissed by operation of law. 
  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   
5 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 0 days)
  -  2 YEARS 6 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS 6 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

*D/L REVOCATION: 28 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 28 months.

TERM OF PROBATION:  5 YEARS;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances 
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
*Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
*Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel during the period of probation.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 (apply bail - to be forward to City of New Berlin Police Department);

FINE:  $2277 (apply bail and balance to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250 (apply bail).

CONDITION TIME:  6 MONTHS- NON WORKING HOURS w/Standard Release Conditions.   To commence forthwith. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 28, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Sonderhous is requesting a plea and sentencing date in July.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Charles G Kreckel in court with attorney Ronald J. Sonderhouse.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Preliminary hearing on March 4, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program. He shall report first business day upon release. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.   Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court. Defendant allowed non collect calls.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 10:00 am. for status of counsel.
